meanings.definition: A person who cries out or calls loudly, especially to attract attention or give information.
meanings.sent1: The criers in the marketplace announced the arrival of the king.
meanings.sent2: The town criers would walk through the streets, sharing the latest news.
meanings.sent3: The criers at the zoo tried to imitate the animal sounds, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The criers of the forest echoed through the trees, creating a haunting melody.
meanings.sent5: The criers in the play wore colorful costumes and sang with passion.

meanings.definition: A person who weeps or sheds tears.
meanings.sent1: The young child was comforted by the criers at the funeral.
meanings.sent2: The movie always made her a criers, no matter how many times she watched it.
meanings.sent3: The criers at the sad movie night used tissues by the boxful.
meanings.sent4: The criers in the melodrama shed tears like a waterfall, moving the audience.
meanings.sent5: The criers in the painting had tear-streaked faces, evoking a sense of sorrow.
